newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Hold the phone! Israel's top cop tickets himself.
newsitem.headline: Hold the phone! Israel's top cop tickets himself.

text.p: Israel's national police chief wrote himself a ticket on Thursday for making an illegal cellular telephone call while driving, a police spokeswoman said.

"Commissioner Assaf Hefetz is fining himself," she said after motorists who saw him cradling a phone at the wheel called a radio station to complain. Israeli law allows drivers to make only "hands-free" calls through a microphone.
Hefetz will pay a penalty of $225.
"I thought I was permitted to talk on a mobile telephone if it rested on my shoulder," Army Radio quoted Hefetz as saying.
